intro: Bursaria inermis, commonly known as the smooth bursaria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its leaves are alternate and have a slightly hairy texture, while its flowers are usually pink or white. Bursaria inermis is adapted to dry conditions and is often used in coastal restoration projects due to its hardy nature.
